content:
Sure, in order to help you with research publications and journalists, I will need the following information:

* The industry or topic your product or story belongs to
* The type of publications you want to target, such as trade publications, national newspapers, or online blogs.
* The location of your target audience, if any.

With that information, you can use online databases, such as Cision or Muck Rack, to find contact information for publications and journalists that cover your industry or topic. You can also search Google, social media, and industry websites to find relevant contacts. Additionally, you can look at your competitors' press coverage to identify journalists and publications that have covered similar topics in the past.

You can also try searching for relevant publications and journalists on LinkedIn, Twitter, and other social media platforms. This can help you find contact information and learn more about the publications and journalists you're targeting.

Let me know if you have the info and I can help you more with that.
